title: Here's everything coming to Hulu in December 2022 — and what's leaving; Get ready for a new season of 'Letterkenny,' the time-traveling drama 'Kindred,' a Christopher Nolan binge and much more
text:
Hulu also has "Kindred" (Dec. 13), a terrifying eight-episode miniseries based on Octavia E. Butler's acclaimed novel about a young Black woman (Mallori Johnson) who time travels between modern-day Los Angeles and a plantation in the Antebellum South, and confronts centuries-old family secrets.

Also see: What's coming in December to Netflix | Amazon's Prime Video | HBO Max

Also on the way: "Darby and the Dead" (Dec. 2), a supernatural teen comedy movie; "It's a Wonderful Binge" (Dec. 9), a holiday sequel to 2020's spoof "The Binge" featuring more drunken/stoned shenanigans; and holiday specials including "ABC Tracks Santa: Livestream" (Dec. 24), "The Disney Parks Magical Christmas Day Parade: Livestream" (Dec. 25) and "New Year's Eve: Times Square Ball Drop 2022: Livestream" (Dec. 31).

The Disney DIS-controlled streaming service is also adding a ton of movies, including "The Royal Tenenbaums" (Dec. 1), "Blade Runner: The Final Cut" and "Blade Runner 2049" (both Dec. 26), and a Christopher Nolan binge featuring "The Dark Knight," "Inception," "Dunkirk" and more (all Dec. 12).

Here's the complete lineup of what's coming and going, as of Nov. 21 (release dates are subject to change):
